#### 11. Warranties in Respect of Previous Insurance
*(Applicable to Policy issued to a business or commercial establishment)*
You warrant that:
a. for the risk insured, the Policyholder has never had any insurance terminated in the last twelve (12) months due solely or in part to a breach of any premium payment condition; or
b. if the Policyholder has declared that it has breached any premium payment condition in respect of a previous Policy taken up with another insurer in the last twelve (12) months:
   i. the Policyholder has fully paid all outstanding premium for time on risk calculated by the previous insurer based on the customary short period rate in respect of the previous Policy; and
   ii. a copy of the written confirmation from the previous insurer to this effect is first provided by the Policyholder to Us before cover incepts.
questions: What does the warranty section of the insurance policy for businesses entail?
What conditions must a policyholder meet if they had a previous insurance terminated due to non-payment?
What are the requirements for a policyholder who has breached a premium payment condition in the past 12 months?
How should a policyholder prove they have settled outstanding premiums with a previous insurer?
What is the significance of the 'customary short period rate' mentioned in the insurance policy?
What documentation is required from a previous insurer to validate payment of outstanding premiums?
What happens if a business has had its insurance terminated due to non-payment in the last year?
What does it mean for a policyholder to have fully paid all outstanding premiums for time on risk?
Why is a written confirmation from the previous insurer necessary before a new insurance cover can start?
What are the implications for a business if they fail to provide proof of settled premiums from a previous insurer?
